channel.title: Quick Question
channel.description: Would it be easy to make a file in the client that automatically updates the cache so people don't have to keep redownloading it constantly?

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Okay,
The webclient that comes with the client wont connect to the update server like mine comes with a runescape.jar and i try to run that and it wont connect to the server so tried jarring my own and i have my own webclient for my other server so i know how to jar but anyways i tried to run it and it sends me to a error_game.ws page or whatever.
EDIT: Don’t ask is i have heard or periods or commas cause i haven’t ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question

item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

Sure thing. Just keep an eye on the thread. You probably have to enable it when the client first initiates, as I said, not entirely sure how it works.

Just switch to Hyperion.

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Haha yeah. I will just think of something in the meantime. I love your development thread btw. I miss the old rs and when its complete could you send me the link so i can play?
EDIT: I found a Update.java in my client, would that be the update server thing? If it is why wont it update lmao i have to keep readding the cache as a different name for it to work…

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

To be honest I don’t really know how they work, all I know is my works fine. I think you’ll need the update keys for your revision and possibly load the cache server side, and have the client check for any changes before loading the game up.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question

item.description:

I sorta have a clue on what to do but i was looking for a tutorial on it and i cant find one on this site. Do you know of one so i don’t accidentally screw up on it. I think i can base it off of a hyperion base right? and just change what i need to my variables or would that not work?

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @The_Outsider The Outsider
item.description:
@The_Outsider wrote:

An update server. Yes it would be easier but it won’t be easy unless you know what you’re doing. Hyperion uses this.

Read full topic
